div.class: gdlr-core-title-item gdlr-core-item-pdb clearfix gdlr-core-left-align gdlr-core-title-item-caption-top gdlr-core-item-pdlr

div.p: Loyalsock Township School District comprises an area covering slightly over twenty-one (21) square miles in Lycoming County. The District consists of the Donald E. Schick Elementary School (grades K-5), the Loyalsock Township Middle School (grades 6-8), and the Loyalsock Township High School (grades 9 – 12).
We invite you on a virtual visit of our schools by selecting a building in the “Schools” menu at the top of this window.

div.class: gdlr-core-title-item gdlr-core-item-pdb clearfix gdlr-core-right-align gdlr-core-title-item-caption-bottom gdlr-core-item-pdlr
div.span: In partnership with the community, our district seeks to instill in students high standards for academic achievement, integrity, leadership, service, and responsible citizenship within a safe and healthy learning environment.

div.class: gdlr-core-title-item gdlr-core-item-pdb clearfix gdlr-core-left-align gdlr-core-title-item-caption-bottom gdlr-core-item-pdlr
div.span: As a community of schools, we will prepare students for future challenges, engage students in holistic learning, and inspire students to reach their full potential.

h3.a: School Board Meeting Rescheduled to April 22, 2020 @ 6 pm

div.div:
The Loyalsock Township Board of School Directors has rescheduled the April 8, 2020 School Board Meeting to April 22, 2020,...

li.a: Middle School Enrichment and Instructional Resources
High School Enrichment and Instructional Resources

div.p: On 3/30/2020, Governor Wolf announced that the statewide school closure will last until further notice. We support this decision as the safety and security of our students and their families is our number one priority.
Please see our Continuity of Education Plan posted 3/30/20. It is also posted under our COVID-19 Updates page.

ul.li: Please NOTE: All district facilities including track, stadium, and baseball field, are off limits until further notice.

div.p:
Mondays and Wednesdays:
11:30 AM - 12:30 PM
*Beginning Monday, March 30, 2020
until school reopens

strong.em: HOW WILL WE GET THE DISTRICT-PROVIDED CHROMEBOOKS?

div.p: To date, Grades 4 and 5 have resumed instruction via one-to-one iPads, and are doing well. Grades K-3 will shortly begin use of Chromebooks beginning next week. We will be distributing the Chromebook as follows:

strong.u: Pickup will occur at the High School Main Entrance

strong.em: 4:30-6:30 Late Pickup (for those unable to pick up during school

div.p: Wednesday: 11:30-12:30 Second Chance (for those unable to pick up Monday)
*Any remaining Chromebooks designated for students – a district representative will reach out to assist with distribution.
It is important to remember, that like district iPads, these remain district property, and have care specifications, and will be returned at a later date.
